Introductionïƒ

1. What is a SWPPP?ïƒ

A Storm Water Pollution Prevention Plan (SWPPP) is a legally required document to prevent stormwater pollution at construction sites.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ `What is SWPPP?`_

2. Why is preparing a SWPPP complex?ïƒ

Because it mixes fixed legal text with project-specific details that change for each site.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ `Why SWPPP Preparation is Complex?`_

3. Who are the main people in the workflow?ïƒ

Andy (Product Owner), Jackie (Developer and Bussiness Owner), and Sophia (End User) each play unique roles

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ The Three Key Roles in SWPPP Creation

4. What is a Data Dictionary (DD)?ïƒ

Itâ€™s a centralized list of project data fields (like Project Name, Address, Risk Level).

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ What is Data Dictionary (DD)

5. What is a Blueprint (BP)?ïƒ

Itâ€™s the skeleton of the SWPPP with fixed text plus placeholders for dynamic data.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ What is Blueprint (BP)

6. What is the Screen Registry (SR)?ïƒ

Itâ€™s where forms are designed, defining which fields users will see and fill in.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ What is Screen Registry (SR)

7. What is the Template Designer (TD)?ïƒ

It connects form fields (Screen Registry) to placeholders in the Blueprint.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ What is Template Designer (TD)

8. What is the Document/Data Collector (DC)?ïƒ

Itâ€™s the workspace where end users enter project data and generate the SWPPP.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ What is Document Collector (DC)

9. How does Export work?ïƒ

With one click, the completed SWPPP can be exported as PDF or DOCX.

ğŸ‘‰ Click here to learn more â†’ `Export`_

10. Why are roles split between SME, BA, Developer, and End User?ïƒ

Each role ensures accuracy: SME defines content, BA/Dev build screens, End User fills data.
